comments.text:
Created attachment 574264
source code of XML and XSL and source DOM-code of selection

User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:8.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/8.0
Build ID: 20111104165243

Steps to reproduce:

Preamble: 
1) Forgive me my English: I'm from Ukraine and don't speak English well.
2) Mozilla's version is 8.0, if it can help…

I call an XML-file with an XSLT-prosessing instruction (PI). Then I select all text in the window. I open "source DOM code of selected fragment" to look at the resulting code, not at the source XML. Then I quit Firefox (the session is changed). Then I start Firefox (the session is restored). Than I open DOM-code again.


Actual results:

In the source DOM-code, there a too many occurences of such code: 

<script type="text/javascript">
    function DM_ExtensionEvent(event){
        ...
    };
    convertLinksToDM();
</script>

All the occurences of such a code are EQUAL!


Expected results:

When I open DOM-source code after I open or refresh the page, the code is OK. But when I open it after a restart of Firefox, the code contains many definitions of DM_ExtensionEvent function. I don't know, what it does and what is this function for, but I think the situation shouldn't be like this.
